plugin.name: Portal 6.2 Compatibility Hook for Audience Targeting
plugin.short-description: This module is needed in order for Audience Targeting to work in 6.2
plugin.long-description: This module is needed in order for Audience Targeting to work in 6.2
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Simulator Hook
plugin.long-description: Simulator for the Audience Targeting Apps
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: AntiSamy
plugin.long-description:
Liferay's AntiSamy application protects against malicious code that users may pass intentionally or unintentionally to your portal via their content. The app filters on specific HTML/CSS code and removes suspect JavaScript from it. The application leverages the powerful OWASP AntiSamy library to enforce a content policy that's been proven effective for the online auction site eBay. The app's hook plugin adds an OWASP AntiSamy implementation to your portal's list of existing sanitizer implementations. Liferay Portal uses the AntiSamy sanitizer and any existing configured sanitizers to scrub user input to blogs entries, calendar events, message boards posts, wiki pages, and web content articles.

This app uses OWASP AntiSamy 1.4.4 and is enabled upon the portal's redeployment.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Japanese Localization
plugin.long-description: Liferay's Japanese Localization hook customizes Liferay Portal for Japanese users and administrators. With respect to user name input fields and user name display, the hook properly lists the user's surname first and drops the use of any middle name. In addition, the hook adjusts Liferay Portal to use Japanese compatible address fields.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: MongoDB Expando Adapter
plugin.tags: db, expando, ha, json, nosql, redundancy, sql
plugin.long-description:
This app replaces the backend storage system used for Liferay's "Expando" service framework to use MongoDB instead of the default SQL database used by the rest of Liferay. Many features in Liferay make use of Expandos (such as Document Data Lists and Custom User Attributes). If you need high performance in these areas, consider using MongoDB. MongoDB is an open source, document-oriented NoSQL database. MongoDB focuses on four main things: flexibility, power, speed, and ease of use. MongoDB stores data in JSON documents and contains built-in redundancy and high availability features. For more detail on MongoDB, visit http://mongodb.org. There are multiple portlets included in this app.

This app installs as a Liferay service.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Expando
plugin.short-description: This hook shows how to use Liferay's Expando to automatically create custom fields.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Servlet Filter Hook
plugin.short-description: This hook shows how to add a new Servlet Filter to Liferay's core.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Struts Action
plugin.short-description: This hook shows how to extend Liferay's core Struts actions.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Wrapper
plugin.short-description: This hook shows how to wrap Liferay's core services and models.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Social Bookmarks
plugin.long-description: This app adds additional social bookmarks to Liferay's built-in set of Social Bookmarks. These bookmarks can be used by custom apps, and are also used by Liferay's built-in apps such as its Blogs portlet. Social Bookmarks allow users to easily post a reference to Liferay content on their favorite social networking website. In addition, some websites offer counters that can immediately show users how many people have bookmarked a particular piece of user-generated content.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: 1-2-1 Columns Layout
plugin.long-description:
Layout Templates allow you to choose how portlets will be arranged on a page. They are simple table or CSS-based containers into which portlets can be dropped and sit within the body of the page. Liferay Portal comes with several built-in layout templates, but if you require a more complex page layout you may wish to use this custom layout template. A thumbnail is displayed when the end user clicks Layout Template from the Dock menu. Consult the "Page Creation and Management" section of the Liferay User Guide for details on administering this service. The Liferay User Guide can be found at http://liferay.com/documentation.

This layout will appear in your Page Layouts once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: 1-3-1 Columns Layout
plugin.long-description:
Layout Templates allow you to choose how portlets will be arranged on a page. They are simple table or CSS-based containers into which portlets can be dropped and sit within the body of the page. Liferay Portal comes with several built-in layout templates, but if you require a more complex page layout you may wish to use this custom layout template. A thumbnail is displayed when the end user clicks Layout Template from the Dock menu. Consult the "Page Creation and Management" section of the Liferay User Guide for details on administering this service. The Liferay User Guide can be found at http://liferay.com/documentation.

This layout will appear in your Page Layouts once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: 1-3-2 Columns Layout
plugin.long-description:
Layout Templates allow you to choose how portlets will be arranged on a page. They are simple table or CSS-based containers into which portlets can be dropped and sit within the body of the page. Liferay Portal comes with several built-in layout templates, but if you require a more complex page layout you may wish to use this custom layout template. A thumbnail is displayed when the end user clicks Layout Template from the Dock menu.

This layout will appear in your Page Layouts once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: 2-1-2 Columns Layout
plugin.long-description:
Layout Templates allow you to choose how portlets will be arranged on a page. They are simple table or CSS-based containers into which portlets can be dropped and sit within the body of the page. Liferay Portal comes with several built-in layout templates, but if you require a more complex page layout you may wish to use this custom layout template. A thumbnail is displayed when the end user clicks Layout Template from the Dock menu.

This layout will appear in your Page Layouts once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: 3-2-3 Columns Layout
plugin.long-description:
Layout Templates allow you to choose how portlets will be arranged on a page. They are simple table or CSS-based containers into which portlets can be dropped and sit within the body of the page. Liferay Portal comes with several built-in layout templates, but if you require a more complex page layout you may wish to use this custom layout template. A thumbnail is displayed when the end user clicks Layout Template from the Dock menu.

This layout will appear in your Page Layouts once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Akismet
plugin.tags: akismet, forums, message boards, sanitize, spam
plugin.long-description:
This app integrates Liferay with Akismet. Akismet is a web-based service which automatically detects and eliminates spam from your Liferay message boards, blogs, and wikis. To use this app, obtain an API key from akismet.com and configure it via Control Panel. Once this app is installed and enabled, each forum post, or comment on content such as blogs and wikis will be passed through Akismet. If the post is detected as spam, it will be rejected with a helpful error message.

Internet access is required for this app to work.

This app will appear in your Control Panel once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Calendar
plugin.long-description: Liferay's Calendar app allows users and organizations to create, track, share, and manage events. In addition, the Calendar app supports notifications, integration with Social Office, and staging. As a user, you can create as many calendars as you need. As an administrator, you are able to manage the scheduling of Calendar Resources such as rooms and projectors. All content from the old Calendar portlet is automatically imported into this new application.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Chat
plugin.long-description:
Liferay's Chat portlet provides a convenient way of allowing users to send each other instant messages when they are logged into a Liferay site. It appears as at the bottom of every page, and displays who is logged on, their statuses, and any chats the logged-in user has open. Users can also set audio alerts, and engage in multiple chats.

This app may appear at the bottom of the page.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Flash
plugin.tags: documents and media, flash, social, video
plugin.long-description:
This Flash app allows easy publishing of Adobe Flash content into Liferay. The Flash source file can be specified through a URL so it's possible to publish videos, presentation, games, from a remote website, or directly from Liferay's Documents and Media Gallery.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Google AdSense
plugin.long-description:
Google AdSense is a free, simple way for website publishers of all sizes to earn money by displaying targeted Google ads on their websites. AdSense also lets you provide Google search to your site users, while earning money by displaying Google ads on the search results pages.

This app automatically displays Google Ads based on your AdSense account information and configuration. Options allow you to select your publisher and channel from which ads are served.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Google Maps
plugin.long-description:
This app allows you to place a customized Google Map on a Liferay page, with configuration options to change how the map is displayed.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: IP Geocoder
plugin.tags: geocoding, geoip, ip, ip geocoder, social, whois
plugin.long-description:
This IP Geocoder app locates your geological position, often in conjunction with other apps, such as the Google Maps app.

This app utilizes Max Mind's GeoIP City Database. IP geolocation can be performed by associating a geographic location with the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the user with a physical address. Geolocation usually works by automatically looking up an IP address on a WHOIS service and retrieving the registrant's physical address.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Knowledge Base
plugin.long-description:
Liferay's Knowledge Base app provides a means for creating and organizing articles within a site. The knowledge base is perfect for creating and organizing information more formally than in a wiki. For example, it can be used to hierarchically organize articles to display professional product documentation or to form complete books or guides. It even lets you import article source files written in Markdown, automatically converting them into full-fledged Knowledge Base articles. It's easy to set up the knowledge base with a workflow that requires articles to be approved before they are published. Additionally, the app lets administrators create article templates, to ensure that articles using the template follow a common structure and include certain kinds of information.

Here are the Knowledge Base's new features:
- Navigation built into the Knowledge Base Display
- Suggestions interface for soliciting and managing article feedback
- Article folders
- Article fields for friendly URL, source URL, categorization, and related assets
- Edit on GitHub button can be enabled to take readers to an article's online source repository location
- Import article Markdown source files to create and update articles

Once you've installed the Knowledge Base app, the Knowledge Base page is available in the Site Administration > Content section and the following portlet are available at Applications > Knowledge Base: Knowledge Base Display, Knowledge Base Article, Knowledge Base Search, and Knowledge Base Section.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Logos RefTagger
plugin.short-description: This plugin transforms Bible references via RefTagger.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Mail
plugin.tags: collaboration, email, imap, mail, pop, social
plugin.long-description:
This app enables your users to interact with their email using an easy to use, ubiquitous web interface. If your mail system supports the IMAP protocol, you can use this app to integrate your users' mail with the rest of your web site. You can also connect this app to a mail account provided by Google. The Mail app is a great way to integrate a familiar service with other the collaboration features that Liferay provides.

This app will appear in your Application menu and Control Panel once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Message Boards Subscription Manager
plugin.tags: category, control panel, message board, subscription manager
plugin.long-description:
This app facilitates managing Liferay Portal message boards category subscriptions. In particular, it lets site administrators view user subscriptions and subscribe multiple users to message boards categories.

This app will appear in the Configuration page of Site Administration once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: My Subscriptions
plugin.tags: blog, feed, forum, message board, social, subscriptions, wiki
plugin.long-description:
This app allows users to manage their subscriptions. Users can subscribe to various assets in Liferay, such as subscribing to a blog post, the comments of a wiki page, a message board category (or specific thread), and a host of other items. The purpose of subscriptions is to be notified when something happens related to the item you've subscribed to. For example, if you are subscribed to a message board category, you are notified when a new post or reply occurs within that category. The method of notification is configurable, but is usually in the form of an email sent to all users who have subscribed. There are multiple items that one can subscribe to in Liferay.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Netvibes Widget
plugin.long-description:
Netvibes is a personalized dashboard publishing platform for the Web that includes digital life management, widget distribution services and brand observation rooms.

This app acts as a "container" for Netvibes widgets, such that they can be "hosted" on Liferay and placed on individual pages within a Liferay site.

This app allows you to select from the thousands of existing NetVibes widgets to display on your Liferay sites.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Notifications
plugin.long-description: Liferay's Notifications app provides a convenient way for users to see notifications of important events on any page. It appears at the top of every page inside the user's dockbar. Notifications also allow users to quickly respond through configurable action buttons.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: OpenSocial Gadget
plugin.long-description:
OpenSocial is a framework designed for creating applications, called gadgets that function on any social networking site that supports them. There are many existing gadgets available, and anyone can create their own gadgets. With this app, you can integrate any OpenSocial gadget directly into a Liferay page, and you can easily manage which gadgets are currently in use or available. You can also create your own OpenSocial Gadget using the Liferay's OpenSocial development environment. Gadgets can be integrated into your portal like a portlet to be added or removed by users as desired. The OpenSocial Gadget portlet also allows you to change the permissions for who can view or edit the portlet, as well as options to share the contents of the portlet, just like you can with any other Liferay portlet.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Liferay Push
plugin.long-description:
Liferay Push exposes a framework that lets developers send push notifications from Liferay Portal to native Android and iOS apps. By leveraging Liferay Push, you can ensure that your users know about the latest information on your portal no matter where they are.

Liferay Push also includes a Control Panel portlet that can send test push notifications to ensure that it is working properly.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Release Tools
plugin.short-description: This plugin is used by Liferay release managers to track packages among the Liferay public site, the SourceForge downloads page, and the SourceForge SVN repository.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Ruby Console
plugin.short-description: This plugin provides a console for executing arbitrary Ruby code. Use this portlet should only be used for development.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample DAO
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use DAO in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Drools
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use Drools in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Groovy
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to create Groovy portlets in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Hibernate
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use Hibernate in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample JSON
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use JSON in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample JSP
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to create JSP portlets in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample LAR
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use the LAR (Liferay Archive) service from a portlet.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Permissions
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use the permission service from a portlet.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample PHP
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to create PHP portlets in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Portal Client
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use the portal-client.jar to access Liferay's services using SOAP.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Portal Service
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use Liferay's services throught regular Java calls.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Python
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to create Python portlets in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Ruby
plugin.short-description: This plugin portlet shows how to create Ruby portlets in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Service Builder
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use Liferay's Service Builder in a hot deployable portlet.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Sign In
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to create a sign in portlet in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Spring
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use Spring in Liferay.
plugin.author: SpringSource, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Struts
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use the Apache Struts Bridge with Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Tapestry
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use Tapestry in Liferay.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample UI Search Container Taglib
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use Liferay's UI search container taglib in a portlet.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample UI Taglibs
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to use Liferay's UI taglibs in a portlet.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample WAP
plugin.short-description: This plugin contains several portlets for WAP clients.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Social Office
plugin.tags: collaboration, communication, office, so, social, social office, sync, team
plugin.long-description:
Liferay Social Office is a dynamic team workspace solution that provides holistic enhancement to the way you and your colleagues work together. By adapting today's most innovative social technologies to the unique needs of productivity and goal-driven enterprise teams, it enables an important shift in how and why communication happens. Key features include, but are not limited to:

Documents: shared document repository with Microsoft Office integration.
Communication: instant notifications, team calendars, webmail, task management and contact management.
Collaboration: integrated threaded discussions, blogs, and wikis with related assets and federated search.
People: searchable user profiles with user tagging, friending, integrated chat and simplified Social Office user management.
Mobile: responsive theme that allows your users to collaborate from any device.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

releng.dependent-apps: calendar-portlet, chat-portlet, contacts-portlet, deploy-listener-hook, events-display-portlet, microblogs-portlet, private-messaging-portlet, resources-importer-web, so-activities-hook, so-announcements-portlet, so-configurations-portlet, so-hook, so-theme, so-welcome-theme, tasks-portlet, wysiwyg-portlet

plugin.name: Social Coding
plugin.tags: coding, issues, jira, open source, social, subversion, svn
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Stocks
plugin.long-description:
This app provides a way to visualize the real-time stock price for a given set of stock ticker symbols. Users can enter custom lists to be displayed, or the portlet can be configured to be the same list for all users. Clicking on a stock ticker symbol or entering one in will display a detailed graph of historical values for the stock price of the given symbol.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Tour IPC Portlet
plugin.short-description: This is the Sun Tour IPC plugin. Released April 22, 2008
plugin.author: Sun Microsystems, Inc.

plugin.name: Test Dependency Able
plugin.short-description: Able requires Baker and Charlie.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Test Dependency Baker
plugin.short-description: Baker is required by Able.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Test Dependency Charlie
plugin.short-description: Charlie is required by Able.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Test Dependency Dog
plugin.short-description: Dog requires Able.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Test Dependency Easy
plugin.short-description: Easy requires Fox.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Test Dependency Fox
plugin.short-description: Fox requires Easy.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Test Localized
plugin.short-description: This plugin shows how to localize a portlet.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Twitter
plugin.tags: activity, activity stream, social, tweet, twitter
plugin.long-description:
This app integrates your Twitter timeline into Liferay's Activities framework so that your Tweets show up in your Liferay Activity Stream. Once installed, the app can be added to your private page and configured with your Twitter username. The app will periodically access your tweets through the Twitter API, and import them as Activities. You can view your tweets by adding the Activities portlet onto your personal public or private pages.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Vimeo
plugin.long-description:
This app makes it easy to embed Vimeo videos into Liferay pages. The size, placement, and user options can be configured to optimize the visual appearance of the video and allow for things like full screen playback.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Weather
plugin.long-description:
This app provides a quick visual indication of weather across a configurable set of locations. Locations can be specified using a textual city name (such as "Los Angeles, CA" or "China"), or a postal code (such as 32701 in the U.S.). Links to a summary screen at OpenWeatherMap.org are provided for each location. Temperature readings can be configured for Celsius or Fahrenheit.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Web Form
plugin.tags: csv, database, email, forms, web form
plugin.long-description:
The web forms portlet is a tool that allows a web administrator to define a form to be published in the website. Users visiting the website can then fill the form which is then sent to a configured email address or saved (to file or to database). The title, introductory description of the form, email address, and many other options shown to the users are configurable through the portlet's configuration screen. It is possible to have multiple forms on the same page or spread across multiple pages. Saving options also include the ability to save as an external CSV (Comma-Separated Values) file, or save the values to a custom Database table for further processing.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Wiki Navigation
plugin.long-description:
This app provides additional ways to visualize the structure of wiki contents. It provides two different views into a wiki, including a "Page" view and a "Tree" view. The Page View visually lays out the structure of a single wiki page, allowing users to quickly access different sections of a specific wiki page based on the header levels and other authoring capabilities of a wiki page. Each section is individual collapsible. The Tree View presents a hierarchical, expandable and collapsible view of the entire set of Wiki pages. Pages are shown below their "Parent" pages, and the depth of this view can be controlled through the configuration screen of the portlet.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: WSRP
plugin.long-description:
The Web Services for Remote Portlets (WSRP) specification defines a web service interface for accessing and interacting with interactive presentation-oriented web services in the form of portlets. Using this app, Liferay acts as a WSRP Producer, hosting portlets that will be consumed by other portal servers acting as WSRP Consumers. Liferay can also act as a WSRP Consumer, and host remote instances of portlets that exist on other portal servers that can act as a WSRP Producer.

This app will appear in your Control Panel once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: WYSIWYG
plugin.long-description:
This app enables content authors to quickly and easily create web content using Liferay's built-in WYSIWYG editing capabilities, without the overhead of the full CMS system. Content is associated directly with each instance of this app, and does not have any tracking metadata such as titles, versions, abstracts, or other ancillary information.

Content can be entered into the configuration window and is immediately displayed in the content window of the app. This should only be used when the full capabilities of Liferay's CMS system is not needed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: YouTube
plugin.long-description:
This app makes it easy to embed Youtube videos into Liferay pages. The size, placement, and user options can be configured to optimize the visual appearance of the video and allow for things like full screen playback.

This app will appear in your Application menu once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sample Styled Minimal
plugin.short-description: This is a sample styled theme with minimal configuration set in liferay-plugin-package.properties.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Social Office
plugin.tags: collaboration, communication, office, so, social, social office, team
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Zoe Brochure
plugin.tags: corporate, custom layout, featured item, image carousel, site template, theme
plugin.long-description:
Zoe Brochure offers a modern corporate feel to your site and is versatile enough to be used by a wide variety of industries. The theme comes standard with structures and templates that can be customized to present your products and services with visual appeal. This theme also features a 2-1-2 Columns layout, an image carousel, featured content, and featured download button.

This layout will appear in your Page Settings, under Available Themes once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Zoe Healthcare
plugin.tags: contact form, corporate, featured item, footer contact blurb, footer navigation, healthcare, medical, search, theme, webform portlet
plugin.long-description:
Zoe Healthcare is a preset theme catering to the medical industry. Our theme includes features and templates that can produce custom layouts to outline medical services, chart out available health care plans, and schedule appointments using our form portlet. We utilize a customizable advanced footer that includes: a text blurb, footer navigation, footer links, and social networking links. In the advanced footer you are able to replace any section with web content using a uniquely generated article ID.

This layout will appear in your Page Settings, under Available Themes once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Zoe Resort
plugin.tags: featured item, footer navigation, footer social links, hotel, image carousel, resort, site template, theme
plugin.long-description:
Zoe Resort utilizes a clean layout structure and large dedicated image spaces catering to the needs of the hotel and resort industry, with prominent banners throughout. The theme features a 3-3-3 columns layout, an image carousel, breadcrumbs, featured content, and footer social network links. We utilize a customizable "advanced footer" that includes a text blurb, footer navigation, footer links and social networking links. In the advanced footer you are able to replace any section with web content using a uniquely generated article ID.

This layout will appear in your Page Settings, under Available Themes once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Zoe Tech
plugin.tags: advanced footer, corporate, custom layout, featured item, footer blurb, search, site template, theme
plugin.long-description:
This theme provides a clean and professional feel. It allows you to showcase your clients, services, and products using featured content on the homepage as well as a special image carousel built for this theme. It features a 1-3-1 Column layout only available for the Zoe Tech theme. We utilize a customizable "advanced footer" that includes: a text blurb, footer navigation, footer links, and social networking links. In the advanced footer you are able to replace any section with web content using a uniquely generated article ID.

This layout will appear in your Page Settings, under Available Themes once installed.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Central Authentication Service
plugin.long-description:
The Central Authentication Service (CAS) is a single sign-on protocol for the web that permits a user to access multiple applications while providing their credentials (such as user id and password) only once. It also allows web applications to authenticate users without gaining access to a user's security credentials, such as a password. This app provides integration between Liferay and a CAS implementation, such that users can achieve Single Sign-On when visiting a Liferay site.

This app will install to your application server or servlet container.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Cluster Deployment Helper
plugin.tags: cluster, deployment, enterprise, ha, high availability, replication
plugin.long-description:
Liferay Portal is designed to power the simplest to most complex web sites, easily scaling to the size you need. Liferay works well in clusters of multiple machines (horizontal cluster) or in clusters of multiple VMs on a single machine (vertical cluster), or any mixture of the two. Once you have Liferay installed in more than one application server node, there are several optimizations that need to be made. When deploying apps to a Liferay cluster, each cluster must receive a copy of the app before the app's functionality will work across the cluster.

This app helps deploy other apps within a cluster using the native application server deployment mechanisms.

This app installs as a Liferay service.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Kaleo Workflow
plugin.tags: bi, business intelligence, designer, kaleo, workflow
plugin.long-description:
This app provides the Kaleo Workflow engine, for use with Liferay Portal. In Greek, Kaleo means "called ones," which is appropriate for a workflow engine that calls users to participate in a process that has been designed for them. Kaleo workflow allows a user to define any number of simple to complex business processes/workflows, deploy them, and manage them through a portal interface. Those processes have knowledge of users, groups, and roles. You don't have to write a single line of code to accomplish this: all you have to do is create a single XML document. And if you're a Liferay customer, you get a graphical workflow designer, which gives you a point and click interface to create workflows. Simple workflows can be managed using the default configuration and GUI tools, while more complex workflows can be created to meet the workflow management needs of almost any portal.

This app installs as a Liferay service.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Resources Importer
plugin.tags: configuration, lar, layout, package, theme, web content
plugin.long-description:
The Resources Importer app allows front-end developers to package web content, portlet configurations, and layouts together in a theme without saving it as a compiled .LAR file thereby allowing for greater flexibility in its usage between Liferay Portal versions.

This app will automatically create associated content when other plugins are deployed that are configured to make use of the Resource Importer app.

This app installs as a Liferay service.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Remote IDE Connector
plugin.tags: debug, developer, eclipse, ide, liferay developer studio, remote, server
plugin.long-description: This app provides remote development and deployment support from Liferay IDE. With this app, you can build Liferay projects in Liferay IDE or Liferay Developer Studio, and deploy the projects to a remote host that has this app installed. This app is designed for use with Liferay IDE only.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Skinny JSON Provider
plugin.tags: content, ddl, json, rest, servicebuilder, services web plugin
plugin.long-description:
Liferay's Skinny JSON Provider app provides streamlined representations of your portal's Web Content Articles and Dynamic Data Lists. It gives you lean essential asset data that you can quickly process and analyze.
On installing the app, its JSON web services are available. You can invoke these services from any client that supports JSON. Liferay's page for the JSON web service API has forms that let you try the services. This page also shows you what the client code looks like in JavaScript, cURL, and URL formats.
That's the "skinny" on Liferay's Skinny JSON Provider!
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Sync Connector
plugin.long-description:
This plugin provides the portal services required by Liferay Sync desktop and mobile clients.

Please visit https://www.liferay.com/products/liferay-sync/features for more information on downloading the Liferay Sync desktop and mobile clients. Liferay Sync is compatible with both desktop and mobile environments including Windows, Mac OS, iOS, and Android.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.

plugin.name: Theme Loader
plugin.short-description: This is the Theme Loader plugin.
plugin.long-description:
A theme loader is required to allow the LAR export and import mechanism to hot deploy themes at runtime even if the underlying application server does not support hot deploy.

This app installs as a Liferay service.
plugin.author: Liferay, Inc.
